content.description: Crux is getting off the slab and into the crack (slightly awkward), then enjoy nice locker jams to the bolted anchor.
content.location: This route ascends the angling handcrack left of "Pipsqueak," it is the parallel handcrack to "Pipsqueak" on the left side of the same pillar.

content.description: This is the best looking and most distinctive line on the wall. Although it's quite short, it is a nice climb and might make a good, gentle introduction to steeper crack climbing.
content.protection: #2 Camalots. A #3 Camalot could be finagled in higher in the crack. Fixed rappel anchors.
content.location: This is towards the left side of the wall. Locate a very small roof low to the ground. This climbs the hand crack on the right side of the roof. After surmounting the hand crack trend up and right to a bolted rappel anchor.

content.description: Short and awkward, this one star route ascends the crack directly left of "Sawed Off Runt"
content.location: Second route from the left on the So Low Wall.

content.description: This is the next route immediately to the right of Pipsqueak. Like its neighbour, it's pretty short but not a gimme for the grade.
content.protection: Standard rack. I used cams in the fingers to hand size range. Fixed rappel anchor at the top.
content.location: Just to the right of Pipsqueak. Descend from a bolted rappel anchor.

content.description: A dimunitive little band of basalt that contains a handful of moderate trad climbs.
